20#ifndef __D_EVENT__
21#define __D_EVENT__
22
23
24#include "doomtype.h"
25
26
27//
28// Event handling.
29//
30
31// Input event types.
32typedef enum
33{
34 // Key press/release events.
35 // data1: Key code (from doomkeys.h) of the key that was
36 // pressed or released. This is the key as it appears
37 // on a US keyboard layout, and does not change with
38 // layout.
39 // For ev_keydown only:
40 // data2: ASCII representation of the key that was pressed that
41 // changes with the keyboard layout; eg. if 'Z' is
42 // pressed on a German keyboard, data1='y',data2='z'.
43 // Not affected by modifier keys.
44 // data3: ASCII input, fully modified according to keyboard
45 // layout and any modifier keys that are held down.
46 // Only set if I_StartTextInput() has been called.
47 ev_keydown,
48 ev_keyup,
49
50 // Mouse movement event.
51 // data1: Bitfield of buttons currently held down.
52 // (bit 0 = left; bit 1 = right; bit 2 = middle).
53 // data2: X axis mouse movement (turn).
54 // data3: Y axis mouse movement (forward/backward).
55 ev_mouse,
56
57 // Joystick state.
58 // data1: Bitfield of buttons currently pressed.
59 // data2: X axis mouse movement (turn).
60 // data3: Y axis mouse movement (forward/backward).
61 // data4: Third axis mouse movement (strafe).
62 // data5: Fourth axis mouse movement (look)
63 ev_joystick,
64
65 // Quit event. Triggered when the user clicks the "close" button
66 // to terminate the application.
67 ev_quit
68} evtype_t;
69
70// Event structure.
71typedef struct
72{
73 evtype_t type;
74
75 // Event-specific data; see the descriptions given above.
76 int data1, data2, data3, data4, data5;
77} event_t;
78
79
80//
81// Button/action code definitions.
82//
83typedef enum
84{
85 // Press "Fire".
86 BT_ATTACK = 1,
87 // Use button, to open doors, activate switches.
88 BT_USE = 2,
89
90 // Flag: game events, not really buttons.
91 BT_SPECIAL = 128,
92 BT_SPECIALMASK = 3,
93
94 // Flag, weapon change pending.
95 // If true, the next 3 bits hold weapon num.
96 BT_CHANGE = 4,
97 // The 3bit weapon mask and shift, convenience.
98 BT_WEAPONMASK = (8 + 16 + 32),
99 BT_WEAPONSHIFT = 3,
100
101 // Pause the game.
102 BTS_PAUSE = 1,
103 // Save the game at each console.
104 BTS_SAVEGAME = 2,
105
106 // Savegame slot numbers
107 // occupy the second byte of buttons.
108 BTS_SAVEMASK = (4 + 8 + 16),
109 BTS_SAVESHIFT = 2,
110
111 // [crispy] demo joined.
112 BT_JOIN = 64
113} buttoncode_t;
114
115// villsa [STRIFE] Strife specific buttons
116// TODO - not finished
117typedef enum
118{
119 // Player view look up
120 BT2_LOOKUP = 1,
121 // Player view look down
122 BT2_LOOKDOWN = 2,
123 // Center player's view
124 BT2_CENTERVIEW = 4,
125 // Use inventory item
126 BT2_INVUSE = 8,
127 // Drop inventory item
128 BT2_INVDROP = 16,
129 // Jump up and down
130 BT2_JUMP = 32,
131 // Use medkit
132 BT2_HEALTH = 128,
133
134} buttoncode2_t;
135
136
137// Called by IO functions when input is detected.
138void D_PostEvent(event_t *ev);
139
140// Read an event from the event queue
141
142event_t *D_PopEvent(void);
143
144
145#endif
